dimensions: h. 15.3 cm, diam. 7.3 cm (6 x 2 7/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of William C. Hayes, Class of 1924

texts.textentryhtml: Acquired by William C. Hayes, Class of 1924, from an unknown source, possibly during the Metropolitan Museum of Art excavations at Thebes (Hayes active 1927-1931); given to the Musum in 1930 by Hayes.

bibliography.boilertext: Edouard Naville, T. Eric Peet and W. L. S. Loat, The cemeteries of Abydos, (London; Boston, MA: [published not identified], 1913-1914).
bibliography.citation: Edouard Naville, T. Eric Peet and W. L. S. Loat, The cemeteries of Abydos, (London; Boston, MA: [published not identified], 1913-1914)., Vol. 2: pl. IV, p. 4-5

bibliography.boilertext: William Christopher Hayes, The scepter of Egypt: a background for the study of the Egyptian antiquities in the Metropolitan Museum of Art, (New York: Metropolitan Museum of Art, 1953-1959).
bibliography.citation: William Christopher Hayes, The scepter of Egypt: a background for the study of the Egyptian antiquities in the Metropolitan Museum of Art, (New York: Metropolitan Museum of Art, 1953-1959)., p. 18, fig. 9

bibliography.boilertext: Jean Capart, Primitive art in Egypt, (Philadelphia, PA: J.B. Lippincott Co.; London, H. Grevel & Co., 1905).
bibliography.citation: Jean Capart, Primitive art in Egypt, (Philadelphia, PA: J.B. Lippincott Co.; London, H. Grevel & Co., 1905). , p. 108ff

bibliography.boilertext: Helene J Kantor, "Prehistoric Egyptian pottery in the Art Museum," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University XII, no. 2 (1953): p. 67-83
bibliography.citation: Helene J Kantor, "Prehistoric Egyptian pottery in the Art Museum," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University XII, no. 2 (1953): p. 67-83 , fig. k, p. 70 (illus.)
